title: The Fed Will Probably Cut Rates Today. What Comes Next Matters More.
text:
Market prices currently imply a 90% chance the Federal Reserve will reduce short-term interest rates by a quarter-point to a range of 1.75%-2.0% when policy makers meet this week. Such a move would be consistent with the Fed’s “midcycle adjustment” that began in July.

The interesting question, therefore, is not what the Fed will do to rates when its two-day policy meeting concludes Wednesday, but what it will indicate it wants to do over the next few years. Current pricing implies a 60% chance that the Fed’s rate band will...
description: The market expects the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates by a quarter-point on Wednesday. Investors should be watching for clues about whether this “midcycle adjustment” to monetary policy will get more aggressive.
